author: EFE
title: Una ONG denuncia la muerte de 14 personas en una zódiac al sur de Canarias
text:
Al menos catorce personas han muerto ahogadas en una zódiac cuyos ocupantes llevan pidiendo auxilio desde las 14.00 horas de este jueves desde un punto del Atlántico situado a unos 55 kilómetros de Cabo Bojador, en la costa marroquí del Sáhara Occidental, al sur de Canarias , porque su barca se desinfla y se hunden .
Es la denuncia que realiza la activista Helena Maleno, fundadora de Caminando Fronteras, ONG que lleva toda la tarde de este jueves en contacto con los náufragos y que ha transmitido su posición a las autoridades españolas y marroquíes para que movilicen medios de rescate. Por la localización del incidente, ha asumido la emergencia Rabat.
Maleno ha facilitado a EFE una foto enviada por los supervivientes que todavía siguen a flote , una imagen nocturna y borrosa en la que se ve a entre seis y siete personas sentadas a horcajadas sobre un flotador de una neumática, doblado y medio deshinchado.
Y también un audio que le ha remitido una de las ocupantes de la patera. En él se escucha a una mujer decir en francés: "Estamos aquí, Helena. Soy una mujer embarazada de nueve meses , estoy en el flotador (de la zódiac). Todos los chicos del medio (de la embarcación) han desaparecido, la gente está desapareciendo, hasta ahora no hemos visto a la Marina".
"Toda la gente está desapareciendo. ¡Por favor ayúdennos, ayúdennos! ¡Estamos aquí, ayúdennos! Estamos sentados así en el flotador (se refiere a la imagen que adjunta con el audio). Es muy peligroso, el agua está entrando", se lamenta la mujer
Helena Maleno ha explicado a EFE que, según la información que han recabado sobre esa neumática, se trata de un grupo de 58 personas que salieron el miércoles desde la costa del Sahara hacia Canarias y que ahora se encuentran al suroeste de Cabo Bojador.
Entre ellos, añade, hay siete mujeres (incluyendo a la embarazada) y dos niños .
La portavoz de Caminando Fronteras denuncia que, hasta el momento, Marruecos no ha hecho llegar ayuda a los ocupantes de esa neumática, ni tampoco Salvamento Marítimo español ha intervenido.
Por eso, expresa su temor a que ocurra lo mismo que el 21 de junio, cuando varias personas murieron al hundirse una zódiac al sur de Gran Canaria después de pasar toda la noche esperando a que llegara una patrullera de Marruecos, porque la emergencia la había asumido el Centro de Coordinación de Salvamento de Rabat.
Y ello, a pesar de que un barco de rescate español había estado a solo una hora de distancia de navegación de ellos, socorriendo a otra patera , cuando ya se conocían sus coordenadas.
Ese suceso dio lugar una denuncia de la Fiscalía de Canarias por presunto delito de omisión del deber de socorro contra los responsables del operativo en España, denuncia que desde este verano instruye un Juzgado de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, que ha declarado secretas las actuaciones.

author: Our Bureau
title: February extends near-record temperature trend as sea ice extent plumbs to all-time low  - The Hindu BusinessLine
text:
February continued streak of record or near-record temperatures throughout last two years, according to the Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) implemented by the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF)
“One of the consequences of a warmer world is melting sea ice, and the record or near-record low sea ice cover at both poles has pushed global sea ice cover to an all-time minimum,” says Samantha Burgess, Strategic Lead for Climate at ECMWF.
Daily sea ice extent Daily global sea ice extent, which combines the sea ice extents in both polar regions (North Pole-Arctic region and South Pole-Antarctic region) reached a new all-time minimum in early February and remained below previous record of February 2023 for the rest of the month, the C3S report said.
Arctic sea ice reached its lowest monthly extent for February, at 8 per cent below average. This marks the third consecutive month in which the sea ice extent has set a record for the corresponding month. Antarctic sea ice reached its fourth-lowest monthly extent for February, at 26 per cent below average.
Touches annual minimum The daily sea ice extent may have reached its annual minimum near the end of the month. If confirmed, it would be the second-lowest minimum in the satellite record. Confirmation will only be possible in early March. The new record low for the Arctic in February is not an all-time minimum. Arctic sea ice is approaching its annual maximum extent, which typically occurs in March.
Warmest for Europe Over land, the average temperature over Europe for February 2025 was 0.44°C, which was 0.40°C above the 1991-2020 average for February, ranking it well outside the 10 warmest months of February for Europe. European temperatures were most above average over northern Fennoscandia (Scandinavian and Kola peninsulas including Finland), Iceland and the Alps. A large region of negative anomalies was recorded for eastern Europe.
Above average level Outside Europe, temperatures were most above average over large parts of the Arctic. They were also above average over northern Chile and Argentina, western Australia and the south-western US and Mexico.
But temperatures were most notably below average over parts of the US and Canada. Other regions with below-average temperatures include the regions adjacent to the Black, Caspian and eastern Mediterranean Seas, as well as in a large region in eastern Asia, covering parts of southern Russia, Mongolia, China and Japan.
Average temperature for European land for winter 2025 (December 2024 to February 2025) was joint second highest on record for the season at 1.46°C above the 1991-2020 average, significantly cooler than the warmest European winter in 2020 (2.84°C).

author: chinanews
title: 【这个城市有点潮】昆明：把春天"搬上"餐桌-中新网视频
text:
春日昆明，是花的世界，这里的花不仅在枝头盛放，也是餐盘里美味的"风物诗"。从大观篆新农贸市场的金雀花煎蛋，云南大学食堂的玫瑰宴，到滇厨特调的樱花雪泡……以花入馔，一口浪漫，一口烟火，高颜值菜品的把春味融进生活，让春城的烟火气多了几分仙气。花开时节，和昆明人一起用“吃花”解锁春天的仪式感，“吃透”春天！
责任编辑：【张燕玲】

author: Angelina Berube
title: Guided history hike celebrates Hampstead's 275th
text:
HAMPSTEAD — The Hampstead Historical Society will continue to celebrate the town’s 275th anniversary with a guided history hike from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. July 27 at the West Road Conservation Area, West Road.
Explore the Kent and Brown farm homesteads, both of which were occupied by those families at or just after the founding of Hampstead in 1749. See multiple old cellar holes, a well hole, an animal corral, a couple of original 1749 town line markers, an oak tree from the 1700s, farm fields and the parish land.
The hike will be three miles. Sturdy, waterproof footwear and hiking poles are recommended. The hike will be approximately two hours.
Signup by July 25. Additional details will be sent the day before the hike.
For more information and to register, visit
hampsteadhistoricalsociety.org/275th-anniversary.
Early closure on Saturday
WINDHAM — The town announced the town beach and its parking lot will close at 3 p.m. Saturday and reopen at dawn on Sunday.
There will be no access to the beach or parking lot during this time.
Summer concert series continues
PLAISTOW — Plaistow Recreation will continue its summer concert series on Wednesday through Aug. 14 on the Town Green, 145 Main St.
Concerts last from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. every Wednesday.
Experience the vibrant sounds of the local music scene. Bring chairs and a picnic dinner for a night out.
Knock on Wood will perform on Wednesday.
The remaining concert lineup includes performances by the Timberlane Community Jazz Band, the Timberlane Community Band, North River Music, Relative Soul and Time Bandits.
For weather-related updates, visit
plaistow.com/recreation or check the Plaistow Recreation Department’s Facebook page.
Kingston car show Aug. 3
KINGSTON — The Friends of Kingston Historical Museum Heritage Day will hold a car show from 9 a.m. to noon Aug. 3 at Sanborn Regional High School, 17 Danville Road.
Car registration is $5 per vehicle. All makes and models welcome.
Trophies will be awarded. Registration starts at 8 a.m.
Admission is a minimum donation of $1 per person. All proceeds support the Kingston Historical Museum.
For more information, contact Heidi Corson at 603-702-1811 or email or email .

author: romina.
title: Cuatro regiones siguen en alerta naranja y parte de Andaluc\u00eda en alerta roja
text: La zona suroeste de Andalucía, la provincia de Huelva, está clasificada en alerta roja por la AEMET, la agencia meteorológica española. Lluvias torrenciales se registran en localidades como Cartaya, con 117 l/m² en menos de tres horas. Al hacer clic en“Acepto”aceptas el depósito de cookies por parte de servicios externos y así tendrás acceso al contenido de nuestros socios. Más información en la página de Política de gestión de cookies Acepto Este viernes por la mañana, cuatro regiones españolas siguen en alerta naranja por fuertes lluvias. Se trata de Andalucía, Baleares (excepto Ibiza y Formentera), la comunidad Valenciana y Cataluña. Baleares también están afectadas por alerta por tormentas, a partir de las 10.00 horas para la Isla de Mallorca y desde las 16.00 horas para la Isla de Menorca. Casi tres días después de las lluvias excepcionales que cayeron en el sureste de España, el país sigue conmocionado este viernes por la mañana. Se declararon tres días de luto nacional y el último informe mostró 158 muertes el jueves por la noche. Según las autoridades, esta cifra debería aumentar inevitablemente, dado el gran número de personas desaparecidas que todavía están siendo buscadas. France

author: @zazoomblog
title: La sconcertante scoperta sulla Madonna di Trevignano | di chi è il sangue sulla statua
text:
La sconcertante scoperta sulla Madonna di Trevignano | di chi è il sangue sulla statua Liberoquotidiano.it | 14 feb 2025 Il sangue rinvenuto sulla statua piangente della Madonna di Trevignano appartiene a Gisella Cardia, la sedicente veggente che sosteneva che la lacrimazione della statuetta fosse un fenomeno sovrannaturale ,e che ha a lungo continuato a incontrare i fedeli nella sua tenuta alle porte di Roma anche dopo la richiesta di stop alle manifestazioni religiose imposte dal Consiglio di Stato. Le indagini nei laboratori di Tor Vergata - disposte dalla procura di Civitavecchia, che indaga per truffa - hanno dunque confermato che il sangue appartiene alla “santona”. L'attribuzione del profilo genetico chiude la questione dell'origine del sangue apparso sul volto della statua . Dal 2016 Gisella Cardia ha continuato a lungo a radunare fedeli e pellegrini a Trevignano facendosi portatrice dei presunti messaggi della Madonna piangente. Liberoquotidiano.it - La sconcertante scoperta sulla Madonna di Trevignano: di chi è il sangue sulla statua
Leggi su Liberoquotidiano.it Madonna di Trevignano , sconcertante scoperta : di chi è il sangue sulla statua Gisella Cardia, il “miracolo” di Trevignano: le lacrime della Madonna appartengono alla santona - Ha sempre sostenuto che dagli occhi della statua della Madonnina di Trevignano sgorgassero lacrime vere, di sangue. Ma adesso i primi risultati di una consulenza genetica disposta dalla Procura ... (ilmessaggero.it) Trevignano, nuovi accertamenti su statuetta e quadro - (ANSA) - ROMA, 14 OTT - Nuovo risvolto del caso della Madonna di Trevignano. Sequestrate dai carabinieri alla sedicente veggente Gisella Cardia due statuette. Il procuratore di Civitavecchia ... (msn.com) Madonna di Trevignano, Gisella Cardia con i guanti «per coprire le stimmate»: l'ultimo mistero della santona - L'ultimo "miracolo" della Madonna di Trevignano. Sulle mani di Gisella Cardia «sono comparse le stimmate». Così, la veggente accoglie i suoi adepti (circa 40 accorsi domenica) con i guanti che ... (msn.com)

author: Odinaka Anudu
title: Nigeria intensifies Mpox surveillance at border entry points - Businessday NG
text: Nigeria has ramped up its monitoring and screening procedures at all border entry points in response to the growing threat of Mpox, Clade 1, a highly contagious and deadly strain of the Monkeypox virus. The move, announced by Muhammad Pate, coordinating minister of health and social welfare, comes as the World Health Organization (WHO) declared Mpox a Global Health Emergency, highlighting the urgent need for coordinated international efforts to contain the outbreak. The Nigeria Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) and the Nigeria Ports Health Services have been strengthening the country’s defenses even before the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) classified Mpox as a public health emergency. The Clade 1 strain of Mpox has been particularly devastating, with previous outbreaks resulting in fatalities in up to 10 percent of those infected. Pate emphasised that Nigeria is deploying similar measures to those used during the COVID-19 pandemic to tackle and mitigate the impact of this outbreak. As part of the new measures, all travelers to Nigeria are now required to complete an online health declaration form before their departure. This initiative is accompanied by the activation of infectious disease centers across all 36 states and the Federal Capital Territory, ensuring a robust nationwide response. Pate also urged the public to adhere to preventive measures such as maintaining good hygiene, frequent hand washing with soap and water, or using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer, particularly after contact with an infected person or animal. Mpox is primarily transmitted through close contact, including sexual activity, skin-to-skin contact, and close-range interactions such as talking or breathing near another person. The virus causes flu-like symptoms and skin lesions, and while it can be fatal, with approximately 4 percent of cases resulting in death, outbreaks can be prevented and controlled through vaccination. However, vaccines are typically reserved for those at higher risk or individuals who have been in close contact with an infected person.

organizations.name: africa centres for disease control and prevention (africa cdc
